[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@microsoft/rush-lib](./rush-lib.md) &gt; [RushConstants](./rush-lib.rushconstants.md)

## RushConstants class

> This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Constants used by the Rush tool.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class RushConstants 
```

## Remarks

These are NOT part of the public API surface for rush-lib. The rationale is that we don't want people implementing custom parsers for the Rush config files; instead, they should rely on the official APIs from rush-lib.

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [artifactoryFilename](./rush-lib.rushconstants.artifactoryfilename.md) | <p><code>static</code></p><p><code>readonly</code></p> | string | **_(BETA)_** The artifactory.json configuration file name. |
|  [browserApprovedPackagesFilename](./rush-lib.rushconstants.browserapprovedpackagesfilename.md) | <p><code>static</code></p><p><code>readonly</code></p> | string | **_(BETA)_** The filename ("browser-approved-packages.json") for an optional policy configuration file that stores a list of NPM packages that have been approved for usage by Rush projects. This is part of a pair of config files, one for projects that run in a web browser (e.g. whose approval criteria mostly focuses on licensing and code size), and one for everywhere else (e.g. tooling projects whose approval criteria mostly focuses on avoiding node\_modules sprawl). |
|  [buildCacheFilename](./rush-lib.rushconstants.buildcachefilename.md) | <p><code>static</code></p><p><code>readonly</code></p> | string | **_(BETA)_** Build cache configuration file. |
|  [buildCacheVersion](./rush-lib.rushconstants.buildcacheversion.md) | <p><code>static</code></p><p><code>readonly</code></p> | number | **_(BETA)_** Build cache version number, incremented when the logic to create cache entries changes. Changing this ensures that cache entries generated by an old version will no longer register as a cache hit. |
|  [buildCommandName](./rush-lib.rushconstants.buildcommandname.md) | <p><code>static</code></p><p><code>readonly</code></p> | string | **_(BETA)_** The name of the incremental build command. |

This configuration file should go in the "common/config/rush" folder. |

When watching, controls how long to wait after the last encountered file system event before execution. If another file system event occurs in this interval, the timeout will reset. |

|  [hashDelimiter](./rush-lib.rushconstants.hashdelimiter.md) | <p><code>static</code></p><p><code>readonly</code></p> | string | **_(BETA)_** When a hash generated that contains multiple input segments, this character may be used to separate them to avoid issues like crypto.createHash('sha1').update('a').update('bc').digest('hex') === crypto.createHash('sha1').update('ab').update('c').digest('hex') |

This is part of a pair of config files, one for projects that run in a web browser (e.g. whose approval criteria mostly focuses on licensing and code size), and one for everywhere else (e.g. tooling projects whose approval criteria mostly focuses on avoiding node\_modules sprawl). |
